Grouped_Utterances: I guess I’m afraid of being hurt or betrayed. I’ve been let down before, and it just makes me wary.

I’ve been thinking a lot about it. I realize I have a hard time letting people in, even my friends. Yes, I tend to keep people at arm’s length. I don’t let them see the real me. I’ve been struggling with trusting people lately. I tend to keep my guard up, and I’m trying to work on it.
I think I’d feel vulnerable, and that scares me.

Surprisingly well! The person apologized and moved back. I felt proud of myself for staying calm. I felt relieved and a bit more confident.  I feel a little nervous but also excited.  It felt good to say it out loud.
Yes, I actually had a moment at the grocery store where someone cut in front of me. I took a deep breath and calmly said, “Excuse me, I was waiting in line.”
I’ve been trying to practice the breathing exercises and the calm responses we talked about.

I think I need to keep practicing these conversations and maybe even journal about my feelings. Journaling can be a great tool for processing your emotions. It can help you reflect on your experiences and understand your feelings better.

Maybe I could share something small about myself with a friend and see how they respond. I have a friend I’ve known for years. I think I could try it with her. I want to check in on how the conversation with my friend goes and possibly explore more about why I feel the way I do about trust.
